result.execSummary:
The defendant Sondra Lee Willis was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

3:02 PM Call to Order by Court.  Appearances stated: Defendant Sondra Lee Willis in court.  Attorney Jeffrey Warren Erickson in court for Sondra Lee Willis.  Attorney Luke Steiner in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Attorney Erickson is heard on plea agreement. States agreement. Amending charge to a Disorderly Conduct, a $200.00 fine plus costs. 
State confirms agreement. 

Court reviews plea questionnaire and waiver of rights form with defendant. Defendant states understanding. Court reviews the constitutional and fundamental rights with Defendant. Defendant states understanding. Court reviews the elements of the charge with defendant. Defendant states understanding. Court reviews the minimum / maximum penalties with defendant. Defendant states understanding. 

Court asks defendant for plea. Defendant enters a no contest plea. Court accepts the defendants no contest plea and finds that the defendant freely, knowingly and voluntarily enters plea. Court finds the defendant guilty. 

State is heard on recommendations. To amended charge the State recommends a $200.00 fine plus costs.
Attorney Erickson is heard. Requests a $200.00 fine plus costs and a payment plan. 
Court orders to the amended charge of Disorderly Conduct 947.01, a $200.00 fine plus costs. Apply $150.00 bond. Defendant to stop at Clerks office to establish a payment plan. Total of $705.00, after bond applied $555.00. 60DTP
for disorderly conduct
